hasVariant.name: Caper ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Caper ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses - Women's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have had a pair of Smith Colette sunglasses for the past 7 years and recently the lenses started peeling. Unfortunately since I bought them from a third party store, I wasn't able to have the lenses replaced so I ordered a pair of the Caper sunglasses. I didn't realize they were a matte finish until they arrived, but I will be keeping them since there isn't a glossy finish option without the mirrored lenses (not my style). Such great sunglasses! Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a great pair of polarized sunglasses!
review.name: Excellent Replacement

review.reviewBody: I’ve had mine for three years and they’ve been so greeat!
review.name: Love love love

review.reviewBody: These have been my go-to sunglasses for working outdoors, hiking, and fishing. They stay firmly on my face and I love the shape. Chromapop is a game-changer!
review.name: Great daily sunglasses!

review.reviewBody: I bought two pairs because I love them so much! I get compliments every time I’m wearing them. I hope they never discontinue making these because I will forever only buy this pair! (Matte tortoise w/ chroma pop polarized brown lenses) Seriously couldn’t live without them!!
review.name: My most favorite sunglasses ever!

review.reviewBody: I’m very picky about sunglasses and their fit. I have med-med/large face so finding women’s style sunglasses that don’t squeeze my temples can be challenging. These sunglasses stay put, no sliding even when I sweat but they are still comfortable! Love the Crystal midnight color which is a very dark purple that you would only notice if you look close. Beautiful, comfortable and my new favorite everyday sunglasses!
review.name: Great sunglasses

review.reviewBody: I really like the style of these glasses but I was disappointed with the color. I ordered the camo tort with rose gold lenses. In the photo they look to be a green/black combo with rose/ copper colored lenses. The pair I received is not green at all. They are like a gray/black combo with more of a magenta colored lens. I've asked several people and they agree they don't look like the picture.
review.name: Disappointed with Color

name: Caper ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses - Women's

review.reviewBody: I've been a huge fan of training analytics ever since smart watches became a thing. These Smart Swim 2 Goggles fit in with it all rather swimmingly! The fit is perfect once I took the time to try different nose bridges - it's great that they offer that adjustability. Setup with the phone/Form app is incredibly easy and straightforward. The app comes with a 30 day trial (at the time of writing) allowing you to really get your feet wet risk-free. The display looks a bit funky out of water, but they're meant to be IN the water! Once in the water, the display is clear and vivid without distracting from the swim. The coaching features built into the app look incredibly helpful, though I haven't used them just yet. The heart-rate monitor built into the temple of the goggles works surprisingly well. I typically use a chest strap synced with my watch and have had mixed experience with it, but the goggles eliminate the need for one which is great. Finally, I love the programming options within the app. They make it seamless to sync your workouts onto the goggles for on-board instructions. No more having to keep count of laps and how many more in a particular interval, the goggles do the work for me! I'd highly recommend these goggles as a robust tool in your swimming arsenal.
review.name: Solid Goggles for a Data Nerd

name: Smart Swim 2 Goggles

review.reviewBody: I ordered these for my son on 5/22/24 and received a few days later and today is only 9/28/24 not even four months they’re torn up with holes on the tips of the shoes they are definitely not wroth the $158 discontinued price l paid!!! What a rip off!!!
review.name: Don’t last!

review.reviewBody:
I read reviews on this shoe and bought a pair to check out for bouldering and general purpose. I never got out of the house with them because they're super uncomfortable (for me at least). They're touted as "moderately aggressive", but they put my foot into an extreme arch and wouldn't be comfortable at all between climbs, that much I can say for sure. They may be great for advanced climbers, but this intermediate one thinks it would create an un-fun situation. YMMV! 

Note that backcountry.com got it right - aggressive. Scarpa themselves calls it "moderately downturned", as do most review sites. Bravo, backcountry.com!
review.name: Probably a decent Bouldering shoe, but

review.reviewBody: I have wide feet due to bunions. I had a pair of Muira Vs (known to be a wider shoe from La Sportiva) that were making my bunions hurt more than ever even after I took the time to break them in. I go to the climbing gym about 3-4 times a week for 2+ hours and had my muiras for 4 months and still had pain. These were comfortable pretty much the first day I got them. Would have given 5 stars if the heel was just a little bit smaller. Great shoe overall!
review.name: I wish the heel was a little smaller

review.reviewBody:
This is my second pair of Instinct VS (I bought the first at REI). After only a few weeks, the velcro straps on both shoes nearly entirely lost their grip. It is bad at the point that even though I am now careful and get sure to apply pressure on the vecro when I close it, the strap pops open on at least one of the shoes during nearly every climb.
This seems like a specific issue witn this pair of shoes, since my other pair of Instinct VS do not have this issue, and the velcro is perfectly functional after a year. 

The vecro is perfectly clean, without fibers etc stuck on it, so it should just work!
review.name: Major issues with the velcro straps

review.reviewBody:
These shoes are so good, I don't even mind that there's no room for my big toe. I typically go for 43.5 in climbing shoes, but since the reviews said they run large I went with a 43. That was probably a mistake, but they are slowly but surely stretching to my feet. It's really only in my left big toe that its a problem. Perhaps its just my cartoonishly large digits.

the best feature is the large amounts of top rubber on the top of the toe. you'll break some beta with these. the kind of weird smearing you can do with softer shoes doesn't work so well, but they still do just fine in gyms on volumes etc. you just have to be more technique conscious.
review.name: Really good shoes, big toes beware.

review.reviewBody:
These have become by go to aggressive go to shoes for both the gym and outdoors.  I have resoled a pair and bought a 2nd pair.  I have wide feet and these are very comfortable with a tight fit once broken in.   They may be too roomy for people with narrow feet.

I find these excel at edging and vertical climbs.   They are ok at smearing and work well in cracks that are not too narrow (they have a wide toe box that do not work great in narrow cracks.

Highly recommend!
review.name: Great shoes - on my 2nd pair

review.reviewBody:
When shopping for my next pair of aggressive bouldering shoes, I found that my heel would slip slightly out of the shoe when aggressively pointing my toes. the instinct is the first and only shoe I found that didnt do this. 

I also have extremely wide feet, and these do not bind my toes together like I found that many other shoes did. however, they are slightly shallow in height, so every once in a while I have to pop my heel out because I felt pressure from the toe rubber pushing down right on top of the knuckle of my big toe.

they are decently stiff, which is good for me because I weigh ~190 pounds. BUT, dont let the sx edge rubber scare you; I have not noticed that they are slippery when smearing on volumes. They still grip quite well for heavier climbers, while still being sensitive enough for overhangs and roof problems. the toe is very pointed and quite precise, which is good for improving your footwork.

I've come to realize I prefer one big velcro strap over more intricate lacing systems, like the la sportiva solution lace or the evolv phantom lacing system. I feel like a big strong velcro strap locks my heel down into the shoe better than thinner laces. That's just my opinion though; I know that others disagree.

Now for sizing: take this with a grain of salt, since I have quite wide feet and I have never been able to downsize aggressively like other people on forums say they do. My street shoe is US 11 (sometimes 11.5). I got the instinct in EU 43.5, which equals US 10 1/3. I could probably size down to a 10 for ULTIMATE tightness, but im sorta a baby and dont like cramming my feet into super tight shoes. With the 43.5, my toes are slightly curled, toes touching the front, but do not feel like theyre suffocating. Good mix of performance and comfort, and I can wear them for several attempts before popping them off.

For other reference, I tried the Evolv Phantom in size US 11.5, which was my comfort fit where I could where them for longer periods of time without having to take them off, and in size US 11, where I pretty much had to take them off after every boulder problem I tried, because they were too tight. 

Sizing was a huge problem when I was shopping for new shoes, so hopefully this helps anyone that is interested in the instincts!
review.name: Awesome awesome shoe

review.reviewBody: New to climbing and these shoes are the only ones that seem to fit without feeling too big or painful. I'm a 10.5 with Nike and I went with 43. When I become more experienced maybe I'll try 42.5 but don't hesitate to give these a try. I see a lot of experienced climbers in the gym wearing these around me.
review.name: Simply the best.

review.reviewBody:
Street shoe Men?s 11.5 (12 for most Nike)
Evolv Shaman 11
Evolv Addict 10.5
Five Ten Team 11.5
La Sportiva Solution EU42

Instinct VS EU42 
Highly advise going down 2-2.5 EU sizes from your street shoe to remove all dead space. They?ll mold to your foot and stretch around .25 of a size after about 2 weeks and be perfecto!

Fits like a 2nd skin. No dead space, very tight aggressive fit. I weight about 190 lbs and have no problem using these on anything. Sensitive, precise, and moderately stiff. Toe is kinda whatever, but it does the job. 

Actually prefer these outdoors over indoors.
review.name: Sizing

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have never owned La Sportiva footwear so I was a little nervous but this was soon overcome on the first outing.  I wear an 8.5 to a 9 and I had to get these in a 9.  My feet stayed dry on a recent outing through 4 hours of constant rain, puddles on the trail, creek crossings, and snow.  On dry terrain, the boots grip to granite rock making for secure scrambling or bolder hopping.  I would highly recommend them.
review.name: Outstanding!!

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great boots, like La Sportiva Omega, supportive and sure-footed. They run small and narrow. Size 45 fits a 44.5 or 10.5 foot.
review.name: Feels Like a Modern La Sportiva Omega

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Sadly the fit in the toe box is smaller than other boots from them. So much so that after one hike i'm looking at serious little toe blisters on each foot. Normally I wear a 12 in La Sportiva and have had great success with their other boots with little or no break-in needed. Another size bigger they will be too wide i think. Becides the fit, the construction of these looks very good. Too bad, won't be wearing them again.
review.name: Nice boots but terrible fit.

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Very durable and well-made boot.  I own two pairs (47.5 and 48).  I have 400 miles on 1st pair and opted to size up to a 48 (300 miles on them so far).  They are holding up very well.  I find they breath well and the traction is exceptional.  Most mileage has been in the San Juan Mountains of SW Colorado and the Colorado Front Range with sharp granite terrain.  The soles also grip well on slick rock. They also breath well and are great for tramping through bogs / low water / morning dew.

My only complaint is with the toe box - just wish it was a tad roomier and there was a 48.5 size.  I normally wear between a US 13.5 and 14, and I use full sole orthotic.  The 47.5s were a bit too tight, but not painful.  I then bought a 48, but still need more width in the toe box.
review.name: Durability and Traction.

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love these boots.  So comfortable and handle almost any environment
review.name: Comfort and Safety

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Just summitted Rainier with this boot and it was a game changer. Way more comfortable than trying to be fast & light with a traditional mountaineering boot. On another mountain I was able to comfortably run down the approach with these bad boys. Seem to work great so far on mountains with long approaches where you still need crampon compatibility and the freezing level isn't super low (I can imagine feet getting cold in prime winter conditions with these). I would defininetely get another pair.
review.name: Great FL Boot for the PNW

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wore these for a Mount Rainier summit and they worked perfectly. They didn't have much of a break in period for me, they kept my feet warm in 20 degree farhenheit weather and my feet didn't get too hot while wearing them in 60 degrees. The fit was good, they felt light on my feet without the crampons, and did great while descending on ice/slush/mud. I haven't truly tested their durability yet but initial impressions are good.
review.name: Good boots for mountaineering

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The Trango Tech GTX make for a worthy choice for busting out long trail and backpacking excursions in the North American wilderness. But throw boulder fields, steep scree, talus, and a few mellow pitches of class 5 rock into the mix, and these boots are likely to tear at the sidewalls. That is a complete bummer, because every other part of the Trango Tech lives up to the La Sportiva record of excellence. One short backyard test with crampons proves they hold steady, but under most conditions they will not last more than one long day on glaciers because of the lackluster sidewall material. These synthetic boots should have the same rubber side-wrap found on the leather version. The pictures here show results of only four travel days off-trail and above treeline in Wyoming granite and quartzite mountain ranges.
review.name: Four Days in the Wilderness: Torn and Frayed

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Have about 125 miles of mixed trips with these--heavy snow, easy Sierra summer backpacking, and tougher off-route scrambles.  They broke in OK--took about six days of hiking before they were good to go, and even still I use some KT tape on my ankles to avoid hotspots...but they are comfortable for super long days (18+ hrs hiking) and quite light for the support and relative weather resistance.

My only issue with them, but it's a big one, is I'm not sure I'll get more than two seasons out of them.  It might have been chafing from wearing them with snowshoes but the sides are wearing through on both boots, and in general these look like three year old boots, not six months.  Still comfy though so I'm hoping to wear them until the side gives out further, at which point I'll probably replace them with the full leather version assuming they fit the same.
review.name: Good support, good grip, poor durability

review.itemreviewed: Trango Tech GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots to bridge the gap between mountaineering and hiking boots so I could use them for hiking on trails to mountain summits.  So far these have lived up to the task.  I never got blisters or any other comfort issues.  They were a little weird to get used to walking in at first but that was overcome quickly.  This was probably due to the fact I have never had a mountaineering boot before these.  The only gripe I have about them is when the inside fabric by the ankle of the boot gets wet it seems to take longer to dry out than most footwear I have had in the past.  If you have a boot dryer then no problem but when backpacking for days or weeks at a time this would be an issue especially in higher altitude, colder conditions.  However, these will get their first real test as I utilize them on my backpacking trip in the Sangre De Cristos in September.  Will update my review then.
review.name: So far so good.

review.reviewBody: I chose this hat as a Christmas gift for myself. I have multiple Sunday afternoon hats, though they no longer carry my favorites, this was similar. I haven't worn this yet, but I did unpack it and tried it on. Will be nice to wear for my daily walks and hiking.   I love how it is adjustable and has a chin strap. I thought the color was going to be more of a peri winkle, but it is blue.
review.name: Nice hat, miss my old favorites

review.reviewBody: Great all rounder for hiking, kayaking and Pickleball. Just enough shade without being unwieldy in the wind. Good ventilation on hot days and cleans up well after sweaty activities
review.name: Great all rounder

review.reviewBody: I like that it is crushable, that it protects from the sun but does not lift off from most winds. I especially wanted it for kayaking.
review.name: Great hat.

review.reviewBody: I'm not a fan of the sunglass storage on top of the brim-- it brings the hat brim too far down for good visibility and comfort.
review.name: sunglass storage

review.reviewBody: Excellent fit with maximum sun coverage while staying cool
review.name: Best Gardening & Outdoor Hat

review.reviewBody: Provides excellent protection (SPF 50). Light weight and comforting. Everything about it is great, and LOVE that it has holders for sunglasses!!
review.name: Ultra Escape Boonie solidly met my expectations!!!

review.reviewBody:

Brim is not as large as a floppy hat
review.name: Nice neck cord to keep hat from flying off

review.reviewBody: Fits like a glove.  Great ventilation and very light weight.  Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are a solid gaiter for most weather one will encounter, minus hot days. They are my go-to all around gaiter. The cinch buckle works well to hold them in place. One tip for fit: I wear a size 8.5 US women's boot and size down to get a good fit from these gaiters if you do not have a larger circumference leg.
review.name: perfect mid-weight gaiter for shoulder seasons

review.reviewBody: I first used this product several days ago during a snowstorm. Although it was difficult to get on at first, every successive time is easy to put on and take off. The biggest problem is getting them to properly fit at the top. I need to pull it tighter and then the piece I pull sticks out. It works but could use something to hold it down on the end.
review.name: Best gaiters yet

review.reviewBody: These saved me from a repeat of packing my hiking boots with ice while walking in deep snow. A must have for winter hiking or walking.
review.name: No Ice Boots

review.reviewBody: Well made and will stand up well to tough trail conditions.
review.name: Worth the price

review.reviewBody: Work fantastic to keep my feet dry and warmer. I also use them in snake country to help protect my ankles.
review.name: A great investment

review.reviewBody: They keep the snow out and lower legs dry for snowshoeing, x-country skiing, hiking and orienteering.
review.name: Functionality is great!

review.reviewBody: They keep the snow out and lower legs dry for snowshoeing, x-country skiing, hiking and orienteering.
review.name: Functionality is great!

review.reviewBody: Kept my feet dry and warm during some rainy hiking trips and stream crossings. Would definitely recommend!
review.name: Hold up well against PNW rainforests!

review.reviewBody: These will keep you nice and dry. Tested them for a few hikes already. It was a warm day and the snow was wet and slushy and these gaiters passed the test. They fit true size and I love the height.
review.name: 101% recommend

review.reviewBody: Got my first chance to use these yesterday. Spent most of the day snowshoeing up on Mt. Rainier. A good foot of fresh snow, these kept me dry and warm, even with the driving wind.
review.name: I will be buying some for other family members and my teen.

description: Buy the Industry Nine 1/1 Enduro S 29in Boost Wheelset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 1/1 Enduro S 29in Boost Wheelset
hasVariant.description: Buy the Industry Nine 1/1 Enduro S 29in Boost Wheelset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These came stock on my fully built bike. They have been superb and would certainly buy regardless if stock on a bike or not. The hub isn't too loud which is nice. The engagement truly makes a big difference in riding feel and techy lines. they have been bullet proof having set a few branches into the spokes with no issues. I weigh 220lbs and really like to send it. They are compliant without being too harsh.
review.name: Great wheelset

review.reviewBody: This was an upgrade from my stock Bontrager wheelset, which was fine while it lasted.  I'm not the most precise rider and often smash through rock gardens rather than picking a nice line.  I've ridden this locally on rough trails, hit a few drops, and even done a day with them at the Northstar bike park.  After 6 months of riding and zero problems, I can heartily give it 5 stars.  Not the cheapest for alloy, but true out of the box and have stayed true.  Hub noise isn't obnoxious, but crisp and unique.
review.name: Solid wheelset zero problems

review.reviewBody: I bought these to replace a stock wheel set and I can definitely say it was well worth the money. The wheel is very stiff and yet very light for alloy. I love the engagement and also glad it has the traditional i9 hub noise!
review.name: Great wheel set

name: 1/1 Enduro S 29in Boost Wheelset

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] originally bought as an insulator/mid layer.  The design is especially good under a bib with a shell over because of the insulation in upper torso and arms.  I started wearing on it's own and it works really well and is flattering
review.name: Very versatile

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sweet coat for days in the 50s! Love this comfortable fall / early spring coat. Great look!!
review.name: Awesome coat

review.reviewBody: Didn’t filter like any other.  No protection at back
review.name: Weird
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our product. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we are so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.

We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I already have & love the women's versions, so I got one for my jealous husband. He LOVES it too....In a beautiful bright blue. It's super-light, has insulation that's so light and perfectly placed that you don't feel like you're wearing insulation, except that you're incredibly, comfortably warm...WITHOUT being over-heated. I also gave one to my sister-in-law, who's a big fan too! (The only design tweak I'd like is for them to find a way to keep the sides of the stand-up collar standing up, or folding back to keep it from rubbing the sides of my jawline.)
review.name: Great, versatile, warm, light jacket !!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This thing is spot-on perfect under a rain shell in wet snow or on cold, breezy, rainy days. Being a great lakes region person, I find this very useful, particularly for walking shorelines on days when most other folks stay home.
review.name: Works really well as a light but warm underlayer

review.reviewBody: I have this to my husband for Christmas and he loves it. It’s so soft and the fit is perfect. Marmot is one of his favorite brands.
review.name: Great jacket.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like this jacket. I normally don't require a lot of insulation for chilly weather. The jacket insulates me more than enough and it cuts the wind. I wish a more stout zipper was used for this jacket. The zipper had popped out of where it is anchored to the mating side when zippered for some reason. It can be difficult to fix this when this happens.
review.name: Good fit for me

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket fits the bill as a lightweight packable water resistant jacket for cool nights to moderately cold days. Nice wind block too. The fit is perfect and true to size. My only complaint is no inner chest pocket. Same complaint I have with my North Face that this is replacing.
review.name: Great jacket. Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very light weight, comfortable you don't realize you're wearing a coat, as it's a hybrid model it's up to the not-too-cold days.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son loves it! bought for Christmas, did not disappoint. Excellent fit!
review.name: great jacket!

review.reviewBody: I purchased these for a 10k obstacle course race over rugged terrain with 30 obstacles and they were perfect. My feet felt great and they had great traction no matter the surface. Whether running through mud, up steep embankments, on rocks, or over obstacles I never slipped or lost traction. It was great not having to worry about shoelaces becoming untied or loosening over the course of obstacles. They stayed tight the entire race. They cleaned up great and still look brand new. Not a single blister or rub mark anywhere. I did wear performance socks and would recommend that. I also sized up a half size.
review.name: Would recommend and would buy again.

review.reviewBody:
I wear them everyday, no issues and comfortable 
I have 2- pairs and no issues at all
review.name: Great Shoes and Durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] There is construction problem with the product - it reflects all ground instabilities, shoe sole is thin and hard. Also the boa system makes preasure for foot, using this is disaster!
review.name: Never and never buy this product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm not a climber, but bought these for international travel. Love the sleek look and something other than a sneaker. Super lightweight and comfortable. Youtube video required for BOA system!
review.name: Cool looking shoe!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing shoes! Love The North Face for their innovative ideas! No laces in shoes. Very interesting mechanism that makes your shoes more or less tight by just turning a round shape circle. That's definitely smart as you don't want to get your shoe lace untied in the the middle of a vertical wall.
review.name: Can't wait till trying these shoes in the summer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight, great fit and adjustability. Ankle is a bit high and hasn't yet broken in, but am otherwise happy.
review.name: Great running shoes

name: Summit Cragstone Pro Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: My son was so thrilled that I found these shorts in the length he needed. The shorts fit great and the waist is adjustable, so no belt needed! The material is comfortable and easy-care- no ironing needed.
review.name: Perfect length shorts for my tall son!

review.reviewBody: I have countless stretch Zion pants and shorts and it was nice to find some at a better price then anywhere else.
review.name: Best Shorts Ever Made!

review.reviewBody: These are good shorts that fit me well. I may be in the minority, but the new button design doesn’t bother me.
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: Cheap thin fabric, ugly reflective colors, and the plastic button downgrade.  It’s official: version two sucks. Used to wear the Zion daily, no longer.
review.name: Awful

review.reviewBody: I’ve bought multiple pairs of these for my husband and so , they both love the. They love the comfort and all the pockets.

review.reviewBody: Prana, what were you thinking!? The original Stretch Zion line was already perfect. Why did you take a great selling and well loved line and change it, and especially cheapen it. Bring back the OG Zions, or else!
review.name: If it Ain't Broke, Don't fix it!

review.reviewBody: I have the exact same shorts from several years ago (Zion 28X10) and they fit perfect. These - they feel different, they are smaller, tighter, and the button is a bit strange to button. Sadly will return, as they aren't what I know and love and just not comfortable.
review.name: The changes weren't for the better

review.reviewBody: Like everyone else has said material now seems cheaper and the button change was a bad idea.. have 11 other prana shorts/pants and the new design and change seems cheap and disappointing..
review.name: Read below…

review.reviewBody: I hope Prana reads this.  I have 15 pairs of prana pants and shorts and love them all.  Just got these shorts with this new plastic button and I hate them.  Very disappointing that Prana took something that was so good and ruined it.  Yes it is so bad that if they don't go back to the original button I will never buy Prana again.
review.name: Will never buy Prana with  new button

review.reviewBody: Button pinches whenever I sit down. Cannot get them to fit comfortably. Material has pilled and just feels pretty cheap. Disappointing for expensive shorts, especially as the first version was so good.
review.name: Terrible button

review.reviewBody: I have not used it a lot but fits they way I wanted
review.name: Good Rack

review.reviewBody: This bike rack is exactly what I was looking for.  Fits my Ford F150 great, no issues with install and I see no reason why it wouldn’t fit on any full size truck.  Thule web site said it was not a proper fit for the F150, but I think that was only because it’s a new product and hasn’t been tested yet.  I tow a camper often and need a rack for the back of my truck bed, I also like to brink a row of fire wood in the truck bed, this rack let’s me do both easily.  Both the rack and bikes feel very solid and I’m not concerned at all of either coming loose as this rack is nicely secured to the truck bed.  I considered a less expensive rack from another maker but I’m definitely glad I went with the Thule, fit and finish is great, as expected from Thule.
review.name: Nice Rack!

name: Bed Rider Pro Full Size

hasVariant.name: Alpine Sender Dry Rope - 7.5mm
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Alpine Sender Dry Rope - 7.5mm online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great alpine rope! Extremely light and easy to pack, which makes it excellent for alpine work or if you don’t feel like carrying a 8.5-10mm rope up to a route. I haven’t taken any big whips on the rope, but I’ve had to abort a few routes and it has plenty of elasticity to soak up a fall. My only complaint is that it does like to kink up after a couple climbs forcing you to ‘untwist’ the rope, but since it’s so thin and light that’s somewhat expected. If you need a light, packable, go anywhere rope this is it!
I bought a pair  (orange, blue)for alpine routes. So far I really like these ropes.
review.name: Lightweight and reliable

review.reviewBody: I'm on my second set of these ropes and they have never let me down, except when I want to to go down.  Their weight, dry treatment and durability are fantastic.   After a long, hard season of big ice and mixed routes, they are showing very little wear.  Once the dry treatment is worn they will become my go to for multi pitch rock.  I highly recommend these if you are looking to go fast and light and want the high quality that Mammut is know for.
review.name: My go to ropes for all my alpine and ice missions

review.reviewBody: Handle well, light, bright color. Perfect rope for your project!
review.name: Light rope!

review.reviewBody: Great half rope, feeds really nicely and not super prone to tangles even on long multi's.
review.name: Great smooth alpine half rope

review.reviewBody: This is my go-to rope for anything in the alpine. From 5th class rock to glacier travel I have used this rope extensively in a variety of terrain. The bright orange is a great contrasting color. Despite its small diameter is very durable and has survived many crampons and sharp rock edges over the past year.
review.name: Alpine work horse

review.reviewBody: No frays on this rope while ice climbing this year. I'm sure it got stepped it on, dragged numerous times, and brushed up on the many pointy things needed for ice climbing.  Overall very happy with it.
review.name: Good 1/2 rope

review.reviewBody:
Rope handles well, doesn't pig tail has a middle marker for now. 
Treated me very well last ice season on over 30 days out.
Great for ice climbing. The rope treatment holds up very well and I will be buying another one since it is a half rope.
This rope is featherlight. I bring it ski mountaineering and it's the perfect option for glacier travel, rappelling into a line, or (in a pinch) pitching out a steep section.
review.name: Lightweight rope for glacier travel and ice climbing

name: Alpine Sender Dry Rope - 7.5mm

review.reviewBody: After running in the Torins and getting injured, like a fool I researched after. Knowing I need supporting shoes, I bought the Paradigm 5s and absolutely loved them. Once they wore out I bout the the 6s the foam was too soft and not supportive like the 5s. The 6s were also not responsive like the 5s. I took a gamble on the 7s because I heard they were firmer and they are way better than the 6s. People that started on the 6 probably won't like that, but people who started before the 6s and went to Paradigm for support will love them compared to the 6s.
review.name: Paradigm is back!

review.reviewBody: The zero drop, wide toe box, and solid cushioning sold me on this shoe. It's a great shoe, except the quality is poor. I developed a hole in the upper mesh near my toe after six months, although I only use the shoe for walking. It would be a perfect show aside from this defect.
review.name: Almost perfect, quality issues

review.reviewBody: Wear them casually, specifically when getting groceries, shopping, running errands etc. Very comfortable to wear all day and stand in.
review.name: Very Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Thank you, Altra for giving us the only zero-drop stability shoes with moderate/high cushion in the market. As someone who has had knee surgery and back issues, this shoe is a godsend. Super comfortable and stable. The arch support and the guidance rails are perfect. Please don't change this combination Altra or discontinue this line. My only request to Altra is to give us a trail version of this gem! Currently, none of the Altra trail shoes have an arch support and guidance system.
review.name: Zero drop+ Stability+ 30mm EGO Max foam= Happy back & knees

review.reviewBody: Have 3 pairs. They are great. My knees and feet are feeling better wearing the Paradigm7.
review.name: Will buy again!

review.reviewBody: I've only had them for 2 months, but I love the fit and feel for my wide, zero-arch feet. This could be a 5/5 rating, if not for the fact that the wides don't have a neutral color option, as usual for Altra. This bright blue color is particularly garish and almost put me off of buying them entirely. It severely limits where I can wear them. If the black option was available in wide, I'd have bought a second pair for work and general wear, in addition to my pair for exercise. Maybe even a third in case I can't find something that fits better than this in the future.
review.name: I love the fit, but give the wides the black option

review.reviewBody: Finally a shoe that wont squish my toes and provide cushioning and support. Ive been looking for something like this for over a decade.
review.name: Most comfortable shoes I have ever owned

review.reviewBody: This is my first pair of Altras and a hole developed above my big toe on my left shoe. Had the shoes less than 3 months. For such an expensive shoe I would have expected better wear. Altra would not warranty or replace shoe. I only walk and don't run.
review.name: Didn't last long

review.reviewBody: This is the first pair of shoes (and the 6 before these) that I don't need my expensive orthotics. I need a Metpad to help a problem with the ball of my right foot. I can wear these all day with zero discomfort. When the 6's wear out I'll buy another 7, or maybe 8's when they come out.
review.name: I don't need my orthotics with these shoes!

review.reviewBody: The Paradigm 7 is very comfortable, roomy, cushiony and well built. I've mainly worn the Torin over the years but thought I'd try something different. My feet fell warmer in the Paradigm 7 than the Torin but overall I really like them. BTW: the blue color is a "really bright" blue.
review.name: EXCELLENT SHOE!

name: Paradigm 7 Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Upgraded for my kids xc race bike. Excellent XTR crank
review.name: Great race crankset

review.reviewBody: Great crankset, but no chainring tool was included with the box.  That's annoying.  My order came just like the other reviewer, but there was no lock ring tool.   The write up should be specific.
review.name: No tool included?

review.reviewBody: I ordered a complete crankset with a 32T ring as it was listed on the site... I own a P2max powermeter I will be using with this crankset. From what I have read the locking for the XTR DM chainring is unique to it, and only came with the complete crankset, so I elected to order the complete crank.. The next day after I ordered the complete crankset, I checked my order to see it was now in 2 pieces.. chainring AND crankarms.. not the complete crankset I ordered.. after talking to a support rep online I was told this is how they (competitive) sell the XTR crankset.. I assumed this was more like the complete crankset is not available, so they list it and sell it in 2 parts.. that's fine but buyer beware... the special lockring tool required for the chainring is NOT included with the order, so you either need to purchase the tool, or make a trip to your local bikeshop and see if they can tighten down the lockring for you as they (competitive) do not put the crankset/ring together for you... luckily I already own the tool... also the lockring itself WAS included with just the crankarms (I was told it wasn't) ultimately in the end, I didn't need the chainring... I guess its OK I have it as a spare incase my powermeter needs servicing or something.. nice crankset, but reps I spoke to seemed uncertain of the parts specs... crank itself is a 5 star.. product knowledge given was poor..
review.name: Crank review

name: XTR FC-M9100-1 Crankarms - Boost

review.reviewBody: Planning on using these once it cools down, July in Denver is no jokes but that's also probably why they were marked down so much. They are soft, and the medium fit my hands perfectly, I'm sure these will come in handy once Fall/Winter hits. Also, the red color really pops!
review.name: Nice and Toasty

review.reviewBody: Good mid/ lighter weight gloves for skinning in winter also good in spring/ fall weather.
review.name: I would buy again

review.reviewBody: These are super comfy and soft, thin enough to stay agile for tying knots or any other campsite tasks, but cozy enough to stay warm. I don't think I would trust these to last super long on the trail using trekking poles all day, but that's not what these are for. They're more like glove liners or campsite gloves than proper technical gloves. But for the price, fit, comfort and style, you can't beat them. They match up perfectly with my Trail Mix 1/4 Zip Pullover, which is great for those pics/vids while you're hanging around the campgrounds. Just wish they had more colors.
review.name: Perfect campsite gloves

review.reviewBody: I needed some gloves for in-between winter and spring, and these fit the bill! Love the color, material and fit.
review.name: Perfect Gloves for Shoulder Season

review.reviewBody: I bought these gloves as a liner for my lobster claw gloves used for cycling in the winter. They are a proven winner!
review.name: Warm and well fitted

review.reviewBody: Was hoping for more warmth in winter running. Too bad I purchased 2 pairs. They'll sit in the drawer.
review.name: Not very warm.

review.reviewBody: So warm and comfortable.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Perfect cold weather running/hiking or general outdoor use. Used them on a 6 mile trail run in about 40 degree temps. Hands were warm, but I never sweated. Lightweight, great fit and easy to pack. Touchscreen compatible which is a plus. Worth the money.
review.name: Great Gloves

review.reviewBody: I wear these walking around town and they keep my hands warm walking, waiting for the bus, or going for a run. Unlike many fleece gloves, these slide on and off very easily.
review.name: All around gloves for casual use

review.reviewBody: Just around town and walking. Great product, super warm.
review.name: Great gloves

name: Trail Mix Glove

hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Trail Mini Duo Cook Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Would have been 5 stars, however, the rubber ring around the actual pot is redundant as will instantly slip and fall down to the burner once you start heating things up, almost causing a fire hazard / melty rubber if you're not quick to remove things... Pretty sure this could be easily resolved with a design tweak to the pot, like a lip extrusion/bump on the pot at the bottom of the ring to stop it falling down, but alas, is not to be.
review.name: Great but flawed

review.reviewBody:
Great pot, was able to feed my husband and I while we did the Appalachian Trail. The lil rubber bit eventually starts falling off when the pot gets hot, but ya know its a great way to letyou know the water is boiling without taking the lid off. :) Because this was part of our thru-hike setup, I'm emotionally attached to it so I may be biased in my 5/5 start review. But works real good for 2 people. Does the pot job. 👍🏻
Also the mesh bag fell apart but it last TWO THOUSAND MILES so ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ I'm hoping to find a replacement bag cause I'm never getting rid of this pot.
review.name: Fed 2 Hungry Thruhikers

review.reviewBody: Be careful, don't do like me and don't put your pot in the dishwasher! When I got back from camping I put my pot in the dishwasher to wash it well and it lost its non-stick coating. I’m so disappointed, it was my first use. Otherwise, for my only use, I found the kit to be fine and the size to be just right.
review.name: Don’t put it on the dishwasher

review.reviewBody: In addition to my previous review below, I can say that I think the person suggesting the Windburner coffee press is meant to be reviewing the Solo set because I bought the press and it definitely does not fit the duo. It is also very easy to not burn the plastic bowl on the bottom, I’m not entirely sure how people are doing it. I’ve also never had a problem with the rubber ring slipping down, I’ve been using the pot regularly for the last 3 years.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody:
Great pot, just right for one or two when heating water for dehydrated meals or making pasta. Super compact and fits a 227g msr canister upside down inside, along with all the little accessories (handle, igniter and backup lighter, msr pocket rocket) Has a 500ml and a 1l mark on the inside which is useful. I use it for hiking and bike packing. 

For anyone interested or for the coffee lovers out there, I have tried forever to find a coffee press that fits inside this pot as I love proper coffee. None of the MSR ones for other stoves fit and I didn’t want to have to switch out the whole cooking system to get a Windburner/jetboil just for the press. I can happily confirm that the Jetboil Silicone Grande Coffee Press fits perfectly!
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Amazing kit love it, unfortunately I burned the plastic container, I would like to know if I can buy it, without having to buy the whole pack, thank you very much.
review.name: Burnt plastic bowl need replacement

review.reviewBody: I gave this as a gift to my son-in-law. He liked it very much and was exciterd to get it.
review.name: I gave this as a

review.reviewBody: My partner ordered this stove and it looks remarkably similar to another stove that does not come with a plastic cup...I placed it on the flame without a second thought and burnt straight through the bottom. Is there a way for me to order him a new one and redeem myself?
review.name: How can I reorder the cup?

review.reviewBody:
The only reason it didn't get 5 starts is it did not come with the metal pincher like in the photo. 

Otherwise it's as advertised and I'm happy with it. The insulated rim is great for handling. I tend to just use it to quickly boil water, less to clean that way.
review.name: One part missing, but got the important parts

review.reviewBody: It is easy to use. More than big enough for doing a meal for two people. Easily fits the gas canister and a few extra items inside it as well. Very happy with the set and I would buy it again.
review.name: Light, durable, and good size!

name: Trail Mini Duo Cook Set

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Beautiful and Comfortable! Fit to size 14. Purchased online. Highly recommend very eye catching as well.
review.name: Great Quality Hiker !

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I use these shoes for city walking and hiking. The shoes are very comfortable and great fitting.
The shoes are good for all types of terrain. I walk on sand, cement and rocks around Lake Michigan. I recommend these shoes and the regular Moab speed shoes for milder weather.
review.name: GREAT WALKING AND HIKING SHOES
comment: Thank you for sharing your 5 star review!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wear these boots every day at work. I walk about 12000 steps a day at work and these are hands down the best boots I've ever worn. They are comfortable right out of the box. Feel like a pair of running shoes instead of gore-tex boots.
review.name: Great Boots!!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Needed shoes for a trip to late-November Netherlands!  My old Merrel 'boots' are still with me but have ... transitioned to my 'outdoor work boots' now and so, these Speeds were bought on the quick with the hope.  And man did they deliver.  Brand new shoes, walking over 16,000 steps each day of a FABULOUS 6 day trip thru and around Amsterdam, in the cold and rain.  These shoes were like....what?  let's go!
Merrel had done it again, I have another favorite pair of shoes.  Comfy enough to wear 'all the time', functional enough to 'get the need done'.
review.name: To Amsterdam and back again...

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: out the box they fit very tight wish id gone up half a size from my normal size, hope they stretch a bit. also no arch support or very minimal, my legs/feet lean in a lot when walking.
review.name: fits a little small, not much arch support

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are great footwear for the outdoors. Well constructed no issues.
review.name: Status Check !

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fantastic shoes for every day wear and for more adventurous outings. Breathe well, fit well, holding up with no problem getting twenty thousand steps a day. Getting a replacement insole helped as the one that comes with the shoe is unfortunately thing.
review.name: Great all day

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great quality boot, biggest downfall in my opinion is the laces, they dont stay tight and could have been a heavier weight lace.
review.name: Laces

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots are great! I bought them as replacements and took them on a 3 day, 62 mile hiking weekend without break-in. They performed great as do all my Merrell boots and shoes with no rubbing or blisters. Keep up the good work Merrell!
review.name: Great right out of the box!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have tried multiple brands of hiking boots from Danner, Vasque, Hi-Tek, Bates, etc. The MOAB Speed 2 boots feel great on my feet. I ordered a half size larger than normal due to past experience with Merrell boots (10-10 1/2) and these boots fit great. The heel support is good and the cushion is great. I gave up a pair of Danner's for these. The Danners did not give me the cushion and support I need at my age. The Danners are durable, however I feel the Speed 2's will be also as they seem well constructed. I have only worn them around town and not on any extended hikes at this time. In this application they have been a joy to wear. I will report back after one year and give an update on durability. For now I would say buy with confidence if you are looking for something more than a sneaker but you don't want the hard sole of a more traditional (old school) hiking boot.
review.name: Great Boots!

name: Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Ran the Chicago Marathon in these shoes and they were perfect! Maybe it was the adrenaline but my feet felt like I was running on clouds. They provided the perfect amount of support especially given my high foot arch. Bought the Pelican color and receive many compliments when I wear them. I am a Brooks fanatic for life!
review.name: Very impressed!

review.reviewBody:
Was very excited to try these as I loved the original Ghost Max ,you added colors to the wide width so I didn’t have to chose from only white or black
To my disappointment they are much more snug across the toe box, my big toe was numb after wearing, I even tried a men’s wide to see if that helped and the same problem persists
They are comfortable for my plantar fasciitis so I guess I’ll try the extra wide but super disappointed I have to get black or white
review.name: To snug in toe box

review.reviewBody: Love them so much. They take the sting off a long run. Lots of cushion and equal amounts of spring. Also, best looking running shoe I’ve ever owned. Win win win.
review.name: Good Vibes

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to love these!!! It had everything I wanted the rocker action, the cushioning and the color, I LOVE bright loud running shoes but after several 5Ks on both track and treadmill these feel so heavy and make me feel like I am pulling my legs along by the end of my runs. Was hoping to make these my race shoes for my HM next year. 
I was running in adrenalines prior to this and loved them but after logging 300+ miles on those I wanted something with more cushioning.
Might have to try the Hyperion Max 2 since those are a lighter shoe.
Unable to review as will be returning due to being too tight width wise in toe box
I’m so sad that these are not as good as the first version of this shoe. My main issue is the toe box is so much smaller than v1. Feels fine under foot, I just need more room.
review.name: Much more snug in the toe box than first version

review.reviewBody: Overall they are okay. They take a while to break in because they are so stiff. They are stiff & hard compared to the original ghost max’s. The original Ghost Max was perfect, offered perfect amount of cushion & so extremely comfortable! Brooks took away a great product, I miss the original Ghost Max. But the Ghost Max 2 is just okay.
review.name: Bring back the original Ghost Max!!

review.reviewBody: I got these as a gift because I raved about the Ghost Max shoes I had, so far they were the only shoes I could ever wear without hurting my feet. I got the Ghost Max 2 for Christmas and tried to wear them around the house and my feet were numb because they were so tight across the top of my feet. I had so much trouble finding a pair of shoes I could wear to teach in and I’m so discouraged because I have to start over trying to find a new shoe.
review.name: So disappointed

review.reviewBody: They are my favorite par of shoes yet! I prefer them to the first version of this shoe. They made a lot of good improvements!
review.name: Loved them

review.reviewBody: Love these shoes just had foot surgery and they were the most comfortable shoes that I wore. I am on my feet at work all night. They fit perfectly and are well worth the price.
review.name: Love it

name: Ghost Max 2 Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Honey Stingers are my favorite trail snacks. All their stuff tastes great and on long, high activity days, you can really tell how much they help. I keep a pack of these in my hiking pack, and took several with me on a 6 day, 100+ mile backpacking trip in the Uintas. Tastes like you're eating candy, but gives you the energy you need to keep crushing miles!
review.name: Tasty Treats

review.reviewBody: Bought these as a stocking stuffer (great filler btw to avoid peeking eyes), and we ended up taking a pair out early for our first day snowboarding for the season. I initially wasn’t thrilled on trying out the cherry cola caffeinated flavor, but enjoyed the taste of these as well as the energy kick I got for my first time snowboarding in a very long time (believe me, the energy was needed). Perfect for snacking between runs stashed in my Backcountry Cottonwoods jacket ?? or a pick me up for that afternoon lull when working from home.
review.name: Caffeinated Gummies 10/10

description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness Speedplay Zero Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Speedplay Zero Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness Speedplay Zero Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've been on Speedplay's for 20+ years and they have been virtually bulletproof ... if you keep them greased.  Yeah, the cleats are good for maybe 5,000 miles, if you keep them clean and dry lubed but for me this pedal design is the best.  No compatibility issues with legacy Speedily pedals and the new Wahoo cleats and vice versa.  The Wahoo cleats and pedals work the same as legacy speedplay, which means brilliant.  I like that I don't have to grease them IF the service life is comparable, time will tell on that.
review.name: Same Great Speedplay Pedal, No Grease

review.reviewBody: I have used Speedplay pedals for over twenty years.  I like the ability to engage the pedal with my foot being flat and having a slight amount of play in the pedals.  The cleat on these pedals is way too complicated.  When I could engage the pedal, it was difficult to disengage.  You need confidence in your pedals and these are crap.  If you are a long-term Speedplay user, reconsider before buying these.
review.name: Long-term Speedplay user

review.reviewBody: I’ve had speedplay pedals for years, but never zero pedals. I love them, you don’t have to dial them in to a specific setting (which is how I always thought they worked). I bought them primarily because the of stainless steel base, I had an earlier pair of chromoly pedals get some rust on them after a few years. One bonus is that the ultra light cleats I was already using work great with these pedals, so now I have a backup pair of cleats!
review.name: Speedplay Zero pedals

review.reviewBody: Been riding Speedplays for over 20yrs with no complaints.  Light, low profile, nice float, and no ground strikes when cornering hard when I was still racing.  Still using a set from 20yrs ago on my Zwift rig, and have 4 pairs in total across 4 road bikes.  Simple, durable, and easy to maintain ... haven't even had to replace any bearings on the oldest ones.  Been out of the loop for a while and had no idea they got acquired by Wahoo, but I don't notice any difference in quality.  Love these pedals.
review.name: Favorite Pedals

review.reviewBody:
This is my second pair of Speedplay Zero pedals.  After a short amount of time riding
they develop some lateral play in the spindle.  Just enough to feel a minor clicking 
feeling in the pedals.  I've had one pair replaced, and it happened again.
This brand new pair ... 2 years later... is doing the same thing.
review.name: Great Pedals, still has minor issue.

review.reviewBody: I find the standard Wahoo Speedplay cleats really stubborn. They are very difficult to clip in and very difficult to clip out.  I would say they are dangerously stubborn when clipping out in an emergency. I’ve used Speedplay clips for 21 years.  The Wahoo takeover has hurt quality!
review.name: Stubborn cleats

review.reviewBody: I love Speedplay Zeros.  If you do too, you'll be right at home here.  While I miss the splash of color I don't miss greasing old style Zeros.  (Which I still have to do on old pedals on old bikes.)  I currently have 4 road bikes, all with Speedplays.  "New" cleats have no problems with older pedals.
review.name: Just as good as the old Speedplays

review.reviewBody: I have used speed play pedals for 15 years and finally replaced my last pedals with these new wahoo. They work beautifully
review.name: Wahoo works wonderfully

review.reviewBody: I bough these to replace my old (10 years old) Speedplay Zeros and I am very satisfied with them. Like the new look with stainless all the way around.
review.name: Wahoo - Speedplay Zero Pedals

name: Speedplay Zero Pedals

review.reviewBody:
I am a long-time wearer of Pearl Izumi clothing and have owned several pair of cycling tights. This is the first pair with zero stretch. They are sized WAY too small to have that little give, and once they are on, which is in itself a workout, they wear like low riders. Who wants winter tights that leave a lower back gap???

Very dissappointed.
review.name: tights that DON'T stretch

review.reviewBody: I have an old pair of thermal Pearl Izumi sugar tights that I love. I thought it would be great to have a second pair. My sizing with pearl izumi pants is pretty standard and I have not had issues with their products in the past, however, these pants are the exception. I could barely get my foot through the leg hole. There is no give. To be honest, they fit like an extra small. They aren't even long enough to go down to my ankles!!! In comparison, my other pair which has a little extra length for me at the bottom.
review.name: These pants are defective

review.reviewBody: These have no elasticity whatsoever and fit much snugger than other Pearl Izumi bike pants.  The chamois comes part way down the thigh which feels really weird.  I'm returning these.  What happened to the Pearl Izumi Elite Thermal pants? They were the best.
review.name: No Good

review.reviewBody: They are unbelievably soft. I really wanted these to work as I knot they would be super warm and I really like the look. With that being said, what is with the chamois? It's not that I would say it's big, but it's sewn down far on the leg making it super uncomfortable. Really bummed as I've been doing winter riding and was looking forward to these.
review.name: I really wanted to love these

name: Sugar Thermal Cycling Tight - Women's

review.reviewBody: Insanely great shoes and a super underrated brand right now. These will get more popular, and you'll definitely regret not having gotten a pair of these sooner. I wear a men's 8.5 in street shoes and got these in an 8.5 for an incredibly snug but not painful fit. I would recommend getting your street shoe size, but if you want a performance fit, downsize no more than half a size. Even with getting it in my street shoe size, I had to use parchment baking paper to help get my heel in for the first few times. After the first session it already feels pretty broken in, in terms of getting the shoe on, but is still super snug and tight everywhere on the foot. The shoe is sensitive, but not too soft. The toe rubber is crazy good and the same goes for the heel. 10/10 will be trying/getting more Unparallel shoes!
review.name: Great shoes

name: Flagship Pro Shoe

review.reviewBody: I like Darn Tough and have several different socks from them, including hiking and those ones. Those are pretty comfortable for normal Seattle summers (not heatwaves) and I think I can get away with using them both as dress socks and for casual wear. This model is for everyday wear, I'd use other models for hiking purposes.
review.name: N

review.reviewBody: This sock is very tall on the calf and reminds me more of a dress sock than a crew height tube sock. This really wasn't what I was looking for. I'm exchanging for the Standard Crew, that appears to be more like their hiker crews which I expect to like more. Other than my preference on style, this seems like a great sock. If you wear dress socks almost daily, this might be right for you. May run a little larger to size (size 10 street shoe, L felt a little big even though that's what I normally wear in DTs)
review.name: Not for me

name: Solid Crew Lightweight Sock

description: Buy the Nikwax Waterproofing Wax for Leather Liquid online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Waterproofing Wax for Leather Liquid
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nikwax Waterproofing Wax for Leather Liquid online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Its great for chrome tanned leather doesn’t seem to harm rubber lower and lasts as long as any other product, it also doesn’t seem to overly soften leather when you need a good stiff boot.
nikwax makes the best products for all applications, i definitely notice the difference between their products and the competitors
review.name: best in the business

review.reviewBody: I bought the neutral formula after reading the review about it staining some clothes (I wonder if that person didn't wipe away excess like the instructions ask you to). I don't know if I would use this on ski gloves. I have used just regular leather cleaner and conditioner on gloves. I used this NikWax on two pairs of Keen leather boots and was happy with the experience. As with most NikWax products, it's essential you read the instructions.
review.name: Easy to use

review.reviewBody: I've had great success with the waterproofing from Nikwax products including this one. Using this on my non-Goretex La Sportiva leather boots has kept my feet totally dry in wet snow, mud and water. The container and applicator get a good 2 stars from me since all of the applicator sponges have fallen off well before the bottle is empty making it difficult to use after that.
review.name: Great product if the sponge didn't break off when bottle is half full

review.reviewBody: I purchased this to treat my gloves. After I applied this and I let the gloves dry. The following week I packed up my gear to head to the mountains. After getting to my destination, I found that the black dye in this product was all over my bright green Burton 3L AK jacket. Now I have black streaks all over my outerwear! Terrible stuff stay away!
review.name: Terrible rubs off on everything!

name: Waterproofing Wax for Leather Liquid

review.reviewBody: These gloves are cheaply designed. There's so much palm fabric that bunches up when your grip the bars. It seems they designed them thinking your fingers would be straight out and not curled. Creates a really uncomfortable connection withe the bike and caused blisters on my plams from the extra fabric. I never get blisters, even when riding with no gloves. I've kept trying them, hoping maybe they'd break in, but I'm retiring them and going back to my TLD Airs. I'd rather have to buy TLDs more often (they wear out fast) than wear these. The cuff also doesn't seem to come up high enough so the gloves feel like they are riding low on your wrist. These are a really poor product from a company that is known to produce really great gear.
review.name: Too much palm fabric

review.reviewBody: Second pair of these I've owned. First pair lasted 2 years with a few holes developing around the stitching after 400+ miles of ride time. I've owned these for less than two months (maybe 100 miles of ride time) and they are already coming apart around the stitching. What is happing to the quality of this product FOX?
review.name: Wear Out Fast

review.reviewBody: Glove is decently comfortable, but a little stiff.  Not bad overall, but the palms quickly started having little pieces peal off and they wore out really fast.  About the same price as TLD Air gloves, which I like a million times better and will buy again before I buy these.
review.name: Palm wears out fast

review.reviewBody: Doing a prelim review since my last pair of rangers was from a few years ago and the material was nice and burly, still in one piece after all this time but decided to get a size down with my most recent order and these gloves have got THIN. My scooby doo costume from Spirit Halloween had higher quality fabric than these. I'll update my review as I get more ride time in on these but initial impressions feels like paper mache on my hands
review.name: THIN

review.reviewBody: First pair of riding gloves and very pleased after a couple of uses. Touch screen print works as advertised. Very breathable coming from someone who sweats a ton. Read conflicting reports in reviews about these fitting true to size, however in my experience I had to order a size up to XL (even after following the product sizing guide which told me I was an L). So if your hands run slightly large I'd size up. Great product overall.
review.name: Great Gloves

review.reviewBody:
Grip is good, and I didn't overheat on an extremely hot day.

Also, I was pleasantly surprised to learn that I can use my phone while wearing them. Can't miss at this price!
review.name: Good gloves!

name: Ranger Glove - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Phantom Alpine Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wanted a jacket that's warm, light and can be packed down when I travel in winter. This did exactly that. The only minor minor thing I have is that it would be great if it came with a pack/bag for it...
review.name: Warm and super light

review.itemreviewed: Phantom Alpine Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Sturdy shell, excellent warmth to weight ratio, excellent fit so I don’t look like a giant marshmallow. What I love most about this Jacket is the collar and hood design and construction, it offers excellent protection from the elements and is comfortable and roomy enough to move your head about freely without the jacket or hood binding up. Excellent product!
review.name: Excellent features and my fav puffy

review.itemreviewed: Phantom Alpine Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Super Warm! I love the jacket, but the sizing is a little weird. I’m 5.10, 180lbs and found the Medium to be too constricting in the arms/armpits. I went with a large because the movement of my arms and fit in the arm's was way better,  but the torso is a bit big. Either way it’s fine because I can layer up underneath with another puffer!
review.name: Super Warm, High Quality, Cool Color

review.itemreviewed: Phantom Alpine Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Awesome lighter parka option compared to a typical belay jacket. This is great for a faster paced mission and alpine season. The fit is great for moving while providing substantial warmth. Comfy when needing a warm jacket to rappel in.
review.name: Fits Great for Climbing.

review.itemreviewed: Phantom Alpine Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I can't wait for winter, I got this last winter and I spend most of my days outside.   Very warm
review.name: Come on cold Temps

review.itemreviewed: Phantom Alpine Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I haven't tested this jacket in too cold but the build quality looks awesome and I am sure it will hold good in a dry cold situation. typical MH quality. Recommended!
review.name: Great jacket

review.itemreviewed: Phantom Alpine Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought the black color for casual wear in the winter and for cold days in the mountains. I was able to test it out in the Sierra this past weekend and it was everything I hoped for. It looks great, fits very well over layers, and is extremely light. On top of that, it is very durable. I was wearing it the entire time while I was at my camp and I was never once cold.
review.name: Awesome Down Hoody

review.reviewBody: Last year's model was nearly perfect, only issues were that the fit was a bit overly generous and for whatever reason there was no way to tighten the waist band. This year, it seems they've made the fit even more generous and stuck with the purely symbolic waistband. More importantly though, they added giant zippers on the side which seems like a great idea...until you actually try the pants on. To their credit, they seem to have sourced what has to be the highest quality zipper ever attached to a mid-layer garment, kudos there; but that also seems to be the source of the problem. The zipper is so "beefy" that it is incredibly stiff and prevents the material in the leg from moving like normal clothing. Combine that with the lack and any ability to tighten the waistband and you end up with the leg zippers kind of folding out on themselves resulting in pants that look like hugo boss made them for your ww2 military. The zipper idea is really solid, the ability to take them off without removing you shells is great, but I have to wonder if the team actually tried these on before putting them into production. Backcountry, last years version was so close to perfection and I love the commitment here to high quality materials, but for next year please either go back to the zipperless approach or put in a more flexible zipper and for goodness sake put in a non-decorative waistband.
review.name: Ruined last year's version

review.reviewBody: I had to order a new pair of these. Compared to a season ago these are inferior. The fit is similar but it’s the full size zippers and missing fly for quick bathroom trip that is making me return them.  I suggest to backcountry to bring back the zipper less design.
review.name: Old design was far superior

review.reviewBody: I got these for an insulation layer underneath shell pants for skiing. The short length is good, it does not interfere with the ski boots. The insulation was good for the moderately cold conditions I was in. The fit is weird though, they are baggy around the thighs. Like jodphurs. This didn't matter for my intended use, since I wear them under shell pants. The waist is a little stretchy, but there is no drawstring due to the complications of the design which has full length zippers on each side. There is stitching that looks like a fly, but it is not functional. These would be better if there was a functional fly, and they would be perfect if also the fit was more "normal".
review.name: Weird fit

review.reviewBody: I live in the Upper Midwest and we nomally have some frigid temps.  Used these both Nordic Skiing and Ice Climbing.  They are fantastic.  Didn't over heat or freeze after sweaty exertions.  Well made with great features.
review.name: Love these Insulated Pants

review.reviewBody: I've been riding the Wolverine Cirque Insulated Pants for a few weeks now and they are officially my favorite base-layer ever! They keep me warm on cold days and, best of all, don't get too hot when I'm charging hard. The only thing that could make these better would be drawstrings or some form of adjustable waist. Overall super comfortable and very functional!
review.name: Perfect all condition baselayer

review.reviewBody: Received these pants the other day in preparation for ski season to wear under my bibs on cold days. The quality and fit seems appropriate, though there is no drawstring (or beltloops) to tighten the pant. If you're not the exact size of the pants, there will be some sliding or riding of the waist up or down as you move. It seems crazy to not have built in belt loops or a tie draw string, those little details matter!
review.name: No Drawstring?!

review.reviewBody:
My pant size is 34 x 30 and the mediums fit perfect. the Larges were to big
Jack
review.name: Great Pants-

review.reviewBody:
I'm returning these because of some exceedingly common fit issues I have with Backcountry clothing lately. I ordered according to my waist measurement in the size chart and it felt accurate to me after trying them on. I immediately noticed the main issue with the fit on these when crouched, sat down, and walked up some stairs. The pants basically pull the back side of themselves down any time I moved around. 

I'm 6'3" (192 cm) 180 lbs (82kg) with a 33" (84 cm) waist and ordered a size Medium. Being a cyclist I'd consider my lower body to be fairly muscular, but I wouldn't really consider my legs/butt to be body builder huge. I felt like the length on these when standing straight was perfect with them falling just below the knee, but maybe it would be worth trying a size up when I return these at the warehouse. 

TLDR: If you order based on the size chart and have even a slightly above average butt (not flat), these will probably pull themselves down every time you move. Other than that, made from quality materials and bummed they don't work for me.

 I'll try to update this review if sizing up works out.  I hope this can help some people out with figuring out sizing and maybe Backcountry can make some improvements to these in the next iteration.
review.name: Fit is weird, quality is top notch

review.reviewBody:
I've used these for two full seasons, and love em. I will layer these between a baselayer and some shell pants when conditions get nasty. They've got side zippers for dumping heat, but they're still very warm, so these are a no-go for touring or warmer days.

3/4 length means they sit just above boot cuff very nicely.

I have a 32ish inch waist and a medium is a perfect fit with a baselayer underneath.

They do fit slim, so if you've got large thighs, size up.
review.name: Excellent Layering Solution on Cold Days

review.reviewBody: Other reviews mention this on last year model and it is true: There is no drawstring for the waistband. I now have to cut the band and insert my own ends to tie the pants to keep them from falling down. This is a ridiculous design. Other than that, the pants are insulated and well designed.
review.name: Good not Great - No Drawstring???

review.reviewBody: Received this kit 2 days before leaving for a 2 1/2 week, 5000+ mile trip.  Everything I needed was included in the kit - Really, everything, including stainless fasteners for multiple mounting options, thread-locker, velcro, heat-shrink, and well written clear instructions.  We had cell coverage for all of our trip but a short over-mountain canyon section in eastern Idaho.  My wife (especially) and I frequently work from the road.  In the past she would completely loose connectivity during a zoom or other data heavy usage and would not be able to reconnect...  This trip, with the Drive Reach RV II installed, she had 3, maybe 4, quick glitches when signal would transfer from tower to tower on the move but no disconnects.  We kept the device powered up for the entire time...  With minimal power usage,  I saw no need to turn it off.
review.name: This Thing Works!
