review.reviewBody: This is not designed to light up super bright. It has a nice glow to provide atmosphere or distinguish an area. You’ll be happy you bought it if you use it for the correct purpose and don’t expect it to light up like you’re indoors.
review.name: Nice glow

review.reviewBody: I purchased this as a gift but when tested later it failed. I alerted the company, even though I was prepared to return it to the original store.  I was immediately offered a replacement and it was just received. Works as expected.  It was an ideal resolution to the matter. They stand behind the product without question.
review.name: Nice product, great customer service

review.reviewBody: I ordered one of these lights to test put up at our cabin when sitting on the deck under a patio umbrella.  This little light puts out just enough light to be fun and eliminate the need for a regular full light that would attract bugs easier.  My only wish is that you could order a longer one.  I am going to order 2 more because I am putting this on the edge of the patio umbrella and 1 only does about a 1/3 of it at the edge.  2 more will offer a bit more light as well.  The others at the cabin also liked it and one plans to order a few for their rv.  I enjoy this little light and am glad I bought it.
review.name: Great little cord light!

review.reviewBody: Nice ambiance light, not going to read by it, but pretty cool.
review.name: Neat little toy

review.reviewBody:
Awesome concept, design and very functionable.  I use it to go along the outside edge of a camping tarp. 
A red version of this please!  Just about everything Nite Ize  offers comes in red.  Why does is the Shineline not offered in a red version?
review.name: We Need a RED Version!

review.reviewBody:
Bought several as gifts direct from Nite Ize.  "The campers" are using theirs to light up the camping area and the outline of their car windows.  "The parents" are using theirs to outline their baby's stroller for evening walks.

Shipping was quick -- and they arrived within days of purchase.  You can't go wrong with this company!
review.name: Shine Line: Lots of Uses

review.reviewBody: Just the right amount of colored lighting to enjoy the surroundings.
review.name: Enjoy with a pop of color!!

review.reviewBody: Wow, what a great Birthday Present
review.name: Rechargeable Shine Line

review.reviewBody: I really enjoyed this. It was pleasant to have for indoors at night. I could turn it on in the hunting cabin and not wake everybody up. The cable ties allow you to drape the light over many different places and connect it, preventing it from falling. It's not super bright but just enough to help.
review.name: the cable ties are the best

review.reviewBody: Actually doesnt work even after charging. Disappointing.
review.name: Not what expecting.

review.reviewBody:
Love Smith sunglasses so so much! This style is a great mix between sporty and fashionable. I bought these to replace my sadly discontinued and beloved 'purists' and love this style so much that I just bought the black marble with violet lenses.

PROS: FANTASTIC for folks like me with a small face, super lightweight and comfy (I have problems with glasses pinching my nose, but not these), cute
CONS: They are not my purists ;)
review.name: Great Sunnies - especially for the small faces

review.reviewBody: These shades are light weight and have an amazing fit. I have an oval shaped face and they fit perfectly. The temple pads help when I am super active outdoors to keep them in place. Color through lens is amazing with the chrom-pop feature. Customer services and warranty makes me happy to always purchase this brand .
review.name: Shasta lake is beautiful and so are these !!! Love them!!!!!

review.reviewBody: Y’all are the best company for sunglasses and your warranty is awesome!!!’ I will always buy SMITH sunglasses. Your employees I’ve worked with are great too!!! Thanks so much
review.name: Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: The glasses are comfortable and have good coverage. The lens are wonderful to look through.
review.name: Shasta

review.reviewBody: I like the sunglasses - they are stylish and light in weight overall, but the piece that sits right on my nose is heavy and pretty uncomfortable
review.name: I like the sunglasses -

review.reviewBody: Chroma pop polarized lenses are really great at cutting glare!
review.name: Chroma pop polarized lenses are

review.reviewBody: I love my Lake Shasta sunglasses. They fit perfectly.
review.name: I love my Lake Shasta

review.reviewBody: I like the Lake Shasta but they're a little large for me. The quality is great as all Smith products are just not exactly what I was expecting.
review.name: Liked my previous glasses better

review.reviewBody: These ChromaPop Sunglasses are amazing! They give me a beautiful new frame of the outdoors!
review.name: These ChromaPop Sunglasses are amazing!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love the new Lake Shasta shades! With pink mirror lenses and ChromaPop, they are perfect!
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: Wanted something a bit more nimble to ski with the kiddos. The QST 92 delivered that and a lot more. Easy going, doesn't beat you up, and lots of fun. Loses a bit of stability at speed but fine for my needs.
review.name: Great with kids

review.reviewBody: I'm an adaptive ski instructor and ride a mono ski. This is my favorite ski to teach on and I spent 70+ days on it this past season. It's very responsive and forgiving, it's also very fun and easy to initiate turns with. I get something a little longer and stiffer when skiing for fun, but when teaching beginners this is my go to ski. I also have the QST 99 and 106 but the 92 gets the most love.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Fun ski thats easy to make quick turns with.  Really does well in all conditions.  It's not a great coast to coast caving ski with its short turn radius but thats ok!  This ski is fun and easier on your legs.   Skied all day in the bumps and trees today at Keystone, CO today - pleasure!  Handled the early crunch bumps well in the morning too.
review.name: Definitely a winner!

review.reviewBody:
Great ski, light and responsive 
Best Salomon skis since the “pocket rocket “ and the Salomon “Guns”
review.name: Best Salomon ski since the “pocket rocket”

name: QST 92 Ski - 2025

review.reviewBody: These boots are beautiful and well-crafted. However, according to my wife, they hurt her feet when she wears them for too long. I am very surprised that UGGS did not incorporate its traditional cushion lining into the design to help absorb some of the pressure that my wife feels on her feet. Owing to this issue, I cannot recommend that anyone purchase them.
review.name: These products cannot be worn for long.

review.reviewBody: I would wear this item with leggings,Jean's and a skirt weather it's long or short.
review.name: I would recommend my friends to buy this item.

review.reviewBody: They are fine, not great. The sizing is way off, beware.
review.name: Fine

review.reviewBody: Excellent product to buy the quality is worth the money..
review.name: Love the product.

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable! Wear all day! Great with leggings too. I did have to size down but I'm certainly not complaining about that!
review.name: I loveeeee these boots

review.reviewBody: Tried them on and the fit on the size is perfect. Only thing is I was worried it wouldn't zip up all the way depending on where it landed and for me, I can't zip it all the way because of my big calves.
review.name: Love the look but not for big "CALVES"

review.reviewBody: I needed a boot that was easy to slip on, like an UGG, Classic, but also that I could wear to work, and in weather. This boot serves a a multifunction, yet stylish, AND comfortable boot. Price was a no brainer. I wish they came in more colors!
review.name: YES!

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love this boot, like most of my other Ugg projects. It's a bit heavy, and a little tough to get on. I wanted this to be my go to black winter boot, and for the sale price, I decided to keep it. But I don't see it being a boot that I can put on day after day.
review.name: Wanted to LOVE this boot...

review.reviewBody: These boots are very sleek and beautiful. Perfect height just at the calf area. They are a little stiff but that will work out with wear. They have a generous toe box, good traction. They aren't lined for warmth but I plan to wear them to the office. Fit is just right.
review.name: Beautiful Boots

review.reviewBody: These boots are beautiful and can be worn with leggings, skirts, and dresses they are comfortable and stylish.
review.name: Stylish!

name: Ashton High Chelsea Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a small and sleek bar bag to keep stuff out of my jersey pockets and I found it. I like that it doesn’t require a third strap (new custom bike = expensive paint) due to the size, and the materials and construction are nice. I keep a tube and flat fix stuff in an Orucase saddle bag, and my small phone, credit card/cash, license, and a micro pump  in this bag with room for arm warmers if I shed them during a ride. For longer gravel races I have bigger bar bags but so far I’m liking this one a lot.
review.name: Nice, Small, and Basic Handlebar bag

review.reviewBody: This bag just arrived and I was so excited to put it on my bike.  Except I apparently got the doll sized version?   Even the straps are miniature.  It measures 7” X 3.5” diameter, if I’m being generous with the tape measure.   Not 8” X 4”.   The volume appears to be closer to 1 liter, if you’re lucky.   No way is this a 2 liter bag.   It would barely fit my iphone12.  Heaven help you if you have a galaxy!  Definitely not space for a jacket.    The copywriter for this item probably also thinks 18” of clearance equals the state mandated 3’ required to safely pass cyclists.   I bet the fish he catches are all “record” size too.  I’m sure his wife was disappointed on their wedding night because his definition of 6” is more like 4” in real life.  It’s headed right back to the seller and I will never trust orucase measurements again.
review.name: did it shrink in the wash?  teeny tiny

name: Smuggler Handlebar Bag

review.reviewBody: Just what I was looking for! Fits everything I need and the material is really easy to clean after traveling around. Definitely recommend adding the travel shoulder strap too.
review.name: Awesome Duffel

review.reviewBody: Vacationing in the outdoors can post challenges to packing, especially when there are multiple activities involved. Being an avid hiker and mountain biker I need bags that hold up and can fit my gear - enter the Osprey Transporter series. My oldest T65 is about 7 years old and still going strong. I purchased a newer version about 3 years ago for my wife and acquired a 3rd this year for my daughter. Again, our vacations require simple gear storage that's portable and that's what you get with these packs. Hauling from campsite to campsite is easy and when on the road the Transporter can be slung over the shoulders for transport from car to hotel. Best luggage I've bought to date.
review.name: A must for the ACTIVE traveler

review.reviewBody: I travel extensively for work and have for more than 30 years. I purchased the Transporter 65 last year and each of the three overseas trips I have taken with it, there have been new abraded spots in the covering and twice accompanied by small tears. I normally expect to get 5 years or more out of a travel bag. This one clearly is not up to the rigors of baggage handlers.... Also, the lack of a shoulder strap is an oversight on the part of the designers...
review.name: Exterior covering does not hold up to routine travel...I

name: Transporter 65L Duffel
Transporter 65L Duffel

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, comfortable for summer temps, and very compressible for a synthetic bag. I’ve never slept in a mummy style rated for summer temps, but the straps that secure the bag to the ground pad kept the bag in place and I was able to toss and turn (as usual) without any impediment. A wonderful lightweight option for summer trips, and I would bet it would stretch to shoulder season weather with the addition of a quilt or other layered sleep system.
review.name: I’d make room in my galactic saddlebag for this

review.reviewBody: Great Bag! Packs up small and is cool enough that I’ll enjoy it in the other 3 seasons but currently using it for winter with the synergy liner and it has been sufficiently warm and light for touring adventures.
review.name: Can do it all

review.reviewBody: I know this doesn't matter at all when it comes to gear but it is nice to such a fun colored bag. I've used it a few times now that I've had it for a month and it is a great bag. The materials are comfortable to sleep in. the length of the bag is great. I am a little bit more broad shouldered then most, and I still fit in the bag well. Only thing in my opinion to make the bag a more versatile bag is if it fully unzipped to use as a blanket on warmer nights. It packs down very nice and is light weight. Would recommend this bag to anyone looking for one.
review.name: the almost perfect sack

name: Space Cowboy Sleeping Bag: 45F Synthetic

review.reviewBody: This was the weirdest fit.  Too long in the arms, too long in the torso, too big around, and yet the armholes were sized for a ten-year-old.  I would have kept it since I could layer things under it without a problem, except for the armholes.  Even with nothing under the jacket, the armholes were too tight.
review.name: Nice if it Fits You

review.reviewBody: I’ve been wearing this non-stop since I bought it a month ago.  It’s so comfortable, both in how it feels and how it manages temperature.  No piling from washing/drying.  I love it so much I bought one for my sister and she loves it too.  Please make more colors!
review.name: Favorite sweater!

review.reviewBody: I really like the colors and the fact that it's thin, so I can wear indoors or layered under winter jacket. Unfortunately, it didn't fit me--it was too tight in the torso and under the arms. I have narrow shoulders so the underarm tightness surprised me. The torso was no surprise as I'm 66 years old and carry my weight in bust and abdomen. I think this brand would work well for younger women. I am 5'7", 125 lbs, and ordered a M. I normally wear a S or M, depending on the brand. The sleeves were also very long so I don't think going up to L would work.
review.name: cute but runs small

name: Thalena Fleece Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the fit adjustment. And tall sizes. And full zip. Will be taking these with me to Glacier National Park with me next month for a 70 mile backpacking trip.
review.name: Bomber pants

review.itemreviewed: Summit Torre Egger FUTURELIGHT Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I owned the product that these pants replaced. They look basically identical. They did not last even a season, covered in holes from normal use in the mountains. DWR wore off immediately and new DWR coatings did not stick well. At the end of the season TNF would not help me out despite huge tears in the pants from normal wear and tear, and denied my warranty claim. I will be sticking with brands producing products I can count on, that stand behind their (much more durable) products.
review.name: I would stay away from TNF Futurelight

name: Summit Torre Egger FUTURELIGHT Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I am 5'4", 122 lbs, 35.5" bust, 30" waist, broad shoulders. I have an Obermeyer ski suit in size 4 that fits beautifully so I ordered this in size 6 thinking I'd have a little extra room to layer over sweaters. I could barely get it on over a thin baselayer! I would probably need at least a 10 to be able to move my arms freely. The jacket is very pretty, love the tall pillowy collar and the belt.
review.name: Beautiful but runs SO TINY!!!

name: Harmony Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the HEST Dually Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: We bought this a month of two though and abused it a couple times and it's fantastic. My one observation is when it gets water onto the mattress, the mattress likes to expand in weird ways. I still think it's worth it though. Just make sure if you get water in it you let it air out.
review.name: Good, but doesn't like water 🤔

review.reviewBody: I recently picked up a bucket list item a Hest mattress. I had slept on one before and it made for a very restful night of sleep. When they went on sale I jumped. Spendy price tag even on sale. But comfort is always a value. 5 out of 5 stars on this product.
review.name: Hest Dual long mattress

review.reviewBody: The Dually is a great mattress!  This rivals my home bed for comfort.  Worth every penny.
review.name: Great Mattress!

review.reviewBody: This HEST Dually is a perfect fit for the back of my Tacoma 3rd generation long bed! No more sleeping on the ground with this sleep set up. The Dually long fits both width and length with the tailgate closed.
review.name: Perfect for the back of my truck bed!

review.reviewBody: This mattress is amazing!  Have used it in a Sprinter Van, Tacoma pickup, and Yurt Camping and it's the best mattress that I have found.  Super high build quality and extremely comfortable.  My 2 favorite things about the Dually are it's quiet when you move around, and there's zero setup time...just unfold and go to sleep.  Highly recommended!
review.name: The best nights sleep!

name: Dually Sleeping Pad

hasVariant.description: Buy the Pendleton Eco-Wise Wool Washable Blanket online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This blanket is not the softest, and I wouldn’t recommend sleeping with it directly on you because wool can make you itchy, but if you freeze at night, this should really help because it’s VERY warm.  I bought the twin size, and it’s cut nice & big.  You won’t have to “short sheet” your own bed to tuck it in.  As far as holding up to being washed goes, I’ve washed it once with wool shampoo in cold water & line dried it, and it came out great.  It’s an investment, but if taken care of properly, I think it will last a really long time.
review.name: Very Warm

review.reviewBody: Overall, I love this Pendleton washable wool blanket. It has the right amount of warmth/breathability and is well-made and attractive. Only point I'd mention is that it took a wash with air-drying to remove a bit of a scent from the blanket, which may have been the result of manufacturing/dye. It was definitely noticeable from first use, but now gone, and the blanket is perfect.    I have since washed it several times, and it holds up wonderfully - no pilling, etc.
review.name: Perfect midweight washable blanket

name: Eco-Wise Wool Washable Blanket

description: Buy the MSR FreeLite 2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: FreeLite 2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR FreeLite 2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: So light! So easy to set up! No complaints! It is super spacious for just me, but I can see that there will be enough room for two of us when I bring my husband along next time (but packs will have to go out in the vestibules).
review.name: No complaints!

review.reviewBody: This is my first "good" tent, having previously used a cheap Amazon one-person tent, so my reference point is pretty low. That said, the tent packs up quickly, and it is light. With my single use, it set up quickly and easily. Please make sure you keep track of the poles because one is mingled in with the others in the sleeve, but it is not attached so that it will fall out. After set up, the interior is roomy enough for a pad and gear for one person. I would not want to share the tent with anyone unless I was very familiar with them, but it is large enough to pack up the sleep system while staying dry inside the tent if necessary. I would not want to set it up in the rain because you must set up the tent before the fly, and the tent body is about 70% mesh. The pockets inside are unique and placed in the right spots. You can place your phone in one of the top pockets and lay there watching videos just like you were at home. It's excellent, and I enjoyed it on the FIRST and so far only outing.
review.name: Impressed

review.reviewBody: It's misleading to call this a 2-person tent. It fits two people...provided they have no gear. Which rather defeats the purpose of a two person *backpacking* tent.
review.name: It's misleading to call this

review.reviewBody: So far this tent has been awesome! It’s light and packs up well. It held the rain out and it kept me dry during our rainy New England season!
review.name: Light and dry

review.reviewBody: MSR provides another exceptional product with this tent. We bought it intending to start backpacking this year and we just got back from our first trip. Had a heavy downpour and we stayed completely dry as well as our gear in the tent and in the vestibules. It’s big enough for two people as long as you are comfortable getting close, would be plenty big for one and all of your gear. It does how ever fit two 25” wide sleeping pads which is great. Sets up and packs down very easy, incredibly light, and very well made. Highly recommend.
review.name: Excellent 2 person backpacking tent.

review.reviewBody: The Freelite 2 is pretty fantastic. I've had it out in some pretty nasty weather so far and it's kept me dry the whole time. It pitches tight with no sag and no wrinkles, the door zippers don't snag and the rainfly doesn't drip water directly into the tent when you open it in the rain. The weight is right for two people and there is enough room in the tent for two adults. The square floor makes it easy to pitch and gives a bit of extra room inside. The fly covers the tent incredibly well and it stands up to heavy rain and wind. Overall a great light tent to take into the backcountry.
review.name: Big upgrade from my old tents

review.reviewBody: Got this tent to upgrade from my r.e.i half dome 2. So far have had it out 6 time including a 6 day trip. This tent is seriously awesome. Myself and 2 dogs fit with plenty of room. Great construction and quality. It being so light weight for the size is the best feature. Look forward to years of use.
review.name: Love this tent

review.reviewBody: Love the weight reduction and rectangular floor plan. I measured the inner tent dimensions and both ends are 50" across, so suitable wide 25" sleeping pads. But honestly, this tent is so lightweight I plan to use it as a solo shelter. The updated mesh inner is a joy to use with gear lofts and lots of pockets. They should just sell the inner tent by itself! The door zippers are bi-directional so they can be vented and the new color scheme is calming and blends into the forest quite well for privacy. I wish the cross-pole was connected to the lengthwise one to prevent loss, but I guess you just need to be careful not to lose it.
review.name: Awesome Upgrade over Previous Model

name: FreeLite 2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
